member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus
member.summary: Specifies all possible crawl stages. These values are used by and to filter the result set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_ACQUIREID
member.summary: The crawl has acquired a new crawl identifier.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_INSERTSTARTPAGE
member.summary: The crawl has added a start address to the list of start addresses to be crawled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STARTCHECK
member.summary: The crawl has attempted to start. A crawl can start if none of the content sources are involved in another crawl.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_START
member.summary: The crawl has started.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_FORBID
member.summary: The crawl has been aborted because one of the content sources is involved in another crawl.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_UPDATE_SEED
member.summary: The index server has stopped the crawl. The server sends this request if another crawl of the same content source is already in progress, the content source has no start addresses, or all of the start addresses are excluded by the crawl rules.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_QUERY_DONE
member.summary: The crawl has checked to see whether it is complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_DELETEUNVISITEDITEMS
member.summary: The crawl has deleted items that were found by the previous full crawl but that were not found by this crawl.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_PAUSE
member.summary: The crawl has paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_RESUME
member.summary: The crawl has resumed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_DONE
member.summary: The crawl is complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_UPDATE_STOP
member.summary: The index server has sent a request to stop the crawl.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_STOP
member.summary: The crawl has stopped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_STATUS_RESET
member.summary: The crawl has cleaned up its data because a search application has been reset.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_START_DELETE
member.summary: The delete crawl operation has started.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_DELETE_CS
member.summary: The delete crawl operation has deleted a content source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.CRAWL_DELETE_SA
member.summary: The delete crawl operation has deleted a start address.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.CrawlHistory.CrawlStatus.NONE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchContextProperties
member.summary: Key to the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint property that specifies names of user profile properties that should be included in the user context that is implicitly submitted with each query. The user profiles are used to enable targeting keywords for particular groups of users, and which properties are available to perform the matching depends on this configuration property. The property value is a list of properties separated with comma (",").

member.summary: A key to the property that specifies the user that will authenticate against the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint administration services. The property value is a string representing a domain\username value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchAdminServiceLocation
member.summary: Key to the property that specifies the location of the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint administration services. The property value is a string representing a protocol://FQDN:port value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchQueryServiceLocation
member.summary: Key to the property that specifies one or more locations of a FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint query service. The property is a list of protocol://FQDN:port values separated by comma (",").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchContextCacheTimeout
member.summary: Key to the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint property that specifies the lifetime, in seconds, for the cached user profile properties used for contextual keyword matching.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchManagedPropertyResultMapping
member.summary: Key to the property that specifies a hash table of property names from the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint farm back-end that needs to be mapped to other property names in the Query SSA. The mapping is required in order to ensure compatible property names returned for the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint Query SSA and the SharePoint Server search SSA. The original properties from FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint will still be present, and the mapped properties will be added.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchDisableUserContext
member.summary: Key to the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint property that specifies whether or not to disable user context sensitive keyword matching. If set to "true", user contexts are not submitted with the query, and any keywords that are associated with user contexts will not be matched.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchResourceStoreLocation
member.summary: Key to the property that specifies the location of the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint resource store. The property is a string representing a protocol://FQDN:port value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Administration.FastServiceApplicationProperties.FASTSearchAlternateAccessMapProperties
member.summary: Key to the FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint property that specifies the managed properties that should have an alternate access mapping applied to them. The property value is a list of managed properties separated by comma (",").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.AlertChangeType.DiscoveredOrModified
member.summary: Specifies to generate a search alert if either a new result is discovered or an existing result is modified after the last time the alert for the registered search query was generated.

The value for each refiner is a format string that specifies the name of a refiner and optionally a set of refinement options for this refiner. For details, see Specifying Refiners. member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.ResubmitFlag
member.summary: Applies to: Microsoft FAST Search Server 2010 for SharePoint Specifies the criteria for automatically resubmitting a query that yielded no results. Each member value indicates an action to be taken if no hits are found. By combining these values you indicate that multiple modifications shall be performed. The effect of an automatic resubmit is that the query is modified and automatically re-evaluated prior to returning the result to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.ResubmitFlag.NoResubmit
member.summary: Do not resubmit the query, but return with zero results.If this value is set, any other ResubmitFlag values are ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.ResubmitFlag.EnableSpellcheckOnResubmit
member.summary: Resubmit the query with automatic spell correction enabled. This corresponds to evaluating the query with the property set to On when re-evaluating the query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.ResubmitFlag.EnableSpellcheckSuggestOnResubmit
member.summary: Resubmit the query with spell check enabled in suggest mode. This corresponds to evaluating the query with the property set to Suggest when re-evaluating the query. This option will still return a query result with zero hits.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.ResubmitFlag.EnableStemmingOnResubmit
member.summary: Resubmit the query with stemming enabled. This corresponds to evaluating the query with the property set to True when re-evaluating the query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.SpellcheckMode.Suggest

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Server.Search.Query.SpellcheckMode.On
